name: SearchFlakyTests
description:
Retrieve a list of flaky tests with pagination support.

Use this tool to fetch information about flaky tests from the Flaky Test Management system. Useful for identifying tests that frequently fail or are unreliable.

parameters.name: filter_query
parameters.description: Search query for filtering flaky tests using log syntax. Keys include 'flaky_test_state', 'flaky_test_category', '@test.name', '@test.suite', '@test.module', '@test.service', '@git.repository.id_v2', '@git.branch', '@test.codeowners', 'env'.

value_schema.description:
Search query following log syntax used to filter flaky tests, same as on Flaky Tests Management UI. The supported search keys are:
- `flaky_test_state`
- `flaky_test_category`
- `@test.name`
- `@test.suite`
- `@test.module`
- `@test.service`
- `@git.repository.id_v2`
- `@git.branch`
- `@test.codeowners`
- `env`

parameters.name: pagination_cursor
parameters.description: A cursor from the previous request to fetch the following results.

value_schema.description: List following results with a cursor provided in the previous request.

parameters.name: maximum_flaky_tests_limit
parameters.description: Specify the maximum number of flaky tests to include in the response.

value_schema.description: Maximum number of flaky tests in the response.

parameters.name: sort_flaky_tests
parameters.description: Sort flaky test results by specified criteria: FQN, first or last flaked, failure rate, etc. Use prefixed '-' for descending order.

value_schema.description: Parameter for sorting flaky test results. The default sort is by ascending Fully Qualified Name (FQN). The FQN is the concatenation of the test module, suite, and name.

parameters.name: request_data_type
parameters.description: Defines the data structure type for the Flaky Tests Search request. Use 'search_flaky_tests_request'.
